creator: BLASTFEMI
title: How to Make a Custom Shirt Design
materials_required: Prewashed, preshrunk shirt in a contrasting color
description: This project provides instructions on how to make a custom shirt design using a cutter/plotter machine and iron-on material. It involves creating a design, cutting it from iron-on material, weeding the design, and pressing it onto a shirt using a heat press.
steps: Create or obtain a design: Design your own artwork or get permission to use someone else's. If using a photograph or JPEG, convert it to a high-contrast black and white image and trace the bitmap. Clean up the design in a vector editing program, ensuring it's suitable for cutting.
Prepare the design for cutting: Open the file in a program that your cutter can read, mirror the image so it will be right-reading when ironed on.
Cut the design: Cut your iron-on material to size, load it into the cutter with the plastic applicator sheet down, and start the cutting process.
Weed the design: Remove all the unwanted iron-on material around the design to reveal the image, using magnifying glasses and direct lighting if necessary.

Press the design onto the shirt: Preheat your heat press. Pre-press the shirt to remove moisture. Place the iron-on sticky side down on the shirt. Press for 30 seconds (or follow the iron-on's instructions).

Finish the pressing: Remove the plastic applicator sheet (hot or cold peel, depending on the iron-on). Cover the design with parchment paper and press again for 7-10 seconds to seal the design into the fabric.
Let cool and wear: Lay the shirt flat and let it cool completely. Then, enjoy your custom-designed shirt.
